description:
Machine-readable registry of all REST API endpoints and WebSocket events for the RFS Station Manager

All API endpoints are protected with rate limiting (100 requests per 15 minutes per IP by default, configurable via RATE_LIMIT_API_MAX environment variable).

Multi-Station Support: All endpoints support optional X-Station-Id header or stationId query parameter for station-based data filtering. Defaults to 'default-station' if not provided.

X-Station-Id.description: Optional station identifier for multi-station filtering. If not provided, defaults to 'default-station' for backward compatibility.

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

GET /api/members.description: Get all registered members sorted by activity level

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

POST /api/members/import.description: Validate CSV file for bulk member import

file.description: CSV file with columns: First Name, Last Name, Rank, Roles

400.description: No file uploaded or CSV parsing failed

POST /api/members/import/execute.description: Execute bulk member import after validation

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

GET /api/activities/active.description: Get currently active activity for station

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

GET /api/checkins.description: Get all check-ins (both active and inactive)

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

POST /api/checkins.description: Check in member or undo existing check-in (toggle)

activityId.description: Activity UUID (uses active if not provided)

400.description: Invalid request or no active activity

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

POST /api/checkins/url-checkin.description: Check in via URL parameter (QR code or name)

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

PUT /api/events/:id/end.description: End an active event (marks as inactive, event remains visible)

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

PUT /api/events/:id/reactivate.description: Reactivate an ended event (clears end time, sets isActive=true)
PUT /api/events/:id/reactivate.notes: Events are automatically deactivated after EVENT_EXPIRY_HOURS (default: 12). Use this endpoint to reactivate expired events.

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

POST /api/events/admin/rollover.description: Manually trigger event expiry check (marks expired events as inactive)
POST /api/events/admin/rollover.notes: Events older than EVENT_EXPIRY_HOURS (default: 12) are automatically marked as inactive. Expired events remain visible in the UI.

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)
Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

GET /api/reports/attendance-summary.description: Get monthly attendance statistics grouped by month

startDate.description: Start date for report range (ISO 8601). Defaults to 30 days ago.

endDate.description: End date for report range (ISO 8601). Defaults to now.

GET /api/reports/member-participation.description: Get top members by participation count

limit.description: Maximum number of members to return

GET /api/reports/activity-breakdown.description: Get breakdown of activities by category

GET /api/stations/lookup.description: Search and locate fire service stations nationally with geolocation sorting. Supports all Australian states and territories.

400.description: Invalid parameters (missing both query and location)

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

notes: Returns merged results: closest stations by distance + matching search results
Results are deduplicated by station ID
Distance calculated using Haversine formula
Search is case-insensitive and matches name, suburb, or brigade
Performance target: < 200ms response time

GET /api/stations/count.description: Get total count of loaded fire service stations (debugging/monitoring)

rateLimiting.description: Rate limited to 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP (configurable)

GET /api/stations.description: Get all stations with optional filtering and pagination

GET /api/stations/brigade/:brigadeId.description: Get all stations in a brigade

200.description: Array of stations in the brigade

DELETE /api/stations/:id.description: Soft delete a station (sets isActive=false). Prevents deletion if station has members, active check-ins, or events.

400.description: Cannot delete station with existing data

POST /api/stations/demo/reset.description: Reset demo station with fresh sample data. Deletes all demo station data and recreates it with realistic samples including members, activities, events, and appliances.
notes: Demo station ID is 'demo-station'
Creates 20 diverse sample members with various ranks
Creates 5 standard activities
Creates 10 recent check-ins
Creates 3-4 events (1 active, rest completed)
Creates 2 appliances with sample check runs
Operation may take several seconds to complete
Emits 'demo-station-reset' WebSocket event on success

POST /api/brigade-access/generate.description: Generate a new brigade access token for kiosk mode. Tokens lock the sign-in interface to a specific station.

brigadeId.description: Brigade ID to associate with the token

stationId.description: Station ID to lock access to

description.description: Optional description for the token (e.g., 'Main Kiosk')

expiresInDays.description: Optional expiration period in days (default: no expiration)

kioskUrl.description: Full kiosk sign-in URL with token

notes: No authentication required per current design
Should be protected with admin authentication in production
Tokens are UUIDs (128-bit random) for security

POST /api/brigade-access/validate.description: Validate a brigade access token and return associated station info

notes: Public endpoint used by kiosk mode middleware
Expired tokens are automatically removed
Should be protected with admin authentication in production

GET /api/brigade-access/brigade/:brigade.description: Get all active tokens for a brigade

notes: Returns only non-expired tokens
Should be protected with admin authentication in production

GET /api/brigade-access/station/:station.description: Get all active tokens for a station

notes: Returns only non-expired tokens
Should be protected with admin authentication in production
Public endpoint for monitoring
Automatically cleans up expired tokens before counting

GET /api/brigade-access/all-tokens.description: Get all active tokens across all stations (admin utility). Returns tokens with full kiosk URLs for easy distribution.

kioskUrl.description: Full kiosk sign-in URL with embedded token

notes: Master admin utility endpoint
Returns only non-expired tokens
Should be protected with admin authentication in production
Used by /admin/brigade-access frontend page
Automatically cleans up expired tokens before returning results
Each token includes pre-formatted kiosk URL for easy copy/paste
Frontend provides QR code generation and copy-to-clipboard features

demo-station-reset.description: Demo station has been reset with fresh data

name.description: Station name (typically same as brigade name for 1:1 relationships)

distance.description: Distance in kilometers from user location (if location provided)

relevanceScore.description: Search relevance score 0-1 (if search query provided)

BrigadeAccessToken.description: Brigade access token for kiosk mode station locking

stationId.description: Associated station ID - kiosk will be locked to this station

description.description: Optional description for the token (e.g., 'Main Kiosk', 'Mobile Tablet')

expiresAt.description: Optional expiration timestamp - token is invalid after this time

updateTriggers: When adding new REST API endpoints
When modifying endpoint paths, methods, or parameters
When adding or changing Socket.io events
